content: I feel the difficulty is misleading. My solution is heavily based off my sudoku solver code, which is in medium. So maybe consider shifting this to medium section. :D
You link a wiki article that i have to read to understand the problem statement. I think it would be best to learn from that wiki article (or elsewhere) how to phrase the problem better.

I enjoyed this puzzle, but it seems like there is another solution for the first 4x4:

4231
1324
2143
3412

```
4 2<3 1

1 3 2 4
^ 
2>1 4 3
^ 
3 4 1<2
```

Adding one more > could prevent multiple solutions?

Also, the puzzle rules don't have a constraint that there's only one possible solution, and the output rules don't say what to do if there are two solutions, so maybe one of those could be added.

It seems that test case 7 (4x4) doesn't have a unique solution:

4231        2134
1324        1423
2143        3241
3412        4312

Both boards look like valid solutions

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Similar to some puzzles (Sudoku) but still different enough to be of interest imo.

Also, It made me discover the Futoshiki, which is quite fun.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It requires Backtracking, i changed it on Hard, now it is good to go ;)
keep doing :)

Input
Line 1: number size of lines to read
Next size lines:

it is missing the sentence. (I think it was there earlier, maybe deleted accidentaly?)

Hello Sundiver.

I think you forgot the "write" line in the stub generator.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: See separate comments.

I solved in PHP by modifying my sudoku solver and found no issues.
While it is similar to sudoku, the difference is enough to justify it as a separate puzzle. 
If my remarks in my other comment is taken care of, I am ready to approve.

Why is the constraint 1 ≤ size ≤ 13 ? 
I think up to n ≤ 9 (size ≤ 17) shall be also allowed (with respective additional test case) to discourage bruteforce. Also, if size = n = 1 is allowed, then an appropriate test case would be needed to check if player is handling this edge case properly. (In this case the validator can be only the same.)
Another small thing: "2n-1 lines of digits 1-n" should be "2n-1 lines of digits 1..n" as the - sign is used twice with different meaning in the same sentence which is not nice, even if understandable.
Medium difficulty is good IMHO and I found your description clear.
Backtracking tag is is good, I have no other recommendation.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

Stuff I would appreciate input on:

- is medium difficulty appropriate? I've chosen the same as sudoku 9x9 (sudoku 4x4 is exactly the same puzzle but rated hard)

- are there other appropriate tags?

- (how) can I make the description more clear?

Thank you for the input. I think I addressed everything you mentioned. I was able to add 2 different 1x1 testcases :)

The size limit of 7 was chosen because my algorithm (I also modified my sudoku algorithm) timed out on a 9x9 puzzle and i was to lazy :(
Right. Fixed it.
STOP CHANGING DIFFICULTY !
good catch, thanks. I added a < to make the solution unique.
thank you, I added a < and amended the constraint.
The difficulty was apparently changed, yes. I originally posted it as medium for that exact reason.
Thanks

My solution takes ~0.85 sec for the 7x7 validator, so also near the timeout limit (PHP is not the fastest kid on the block). Interestingly, the 7x7 IDE test takes 10 times less.  I would recommend to exchange test and validator for 7x7 to avoid that the validator is  harder than the ide test. But it might just depend on what order the backtracking algo tries to fill out the grid, so other solutions might come up with completely different  experience on what takes more time, what takes less time.
So OK for me.
